Title: Dangote Refinery commits to FG pact, says union membership voluntary
Summary: Dangote Petroleum Refinery has reaffirmed that association with any trade union remains voluntary . Association with any union remains strictly voluntary, the refinery says . The refinery says association with unions is in accordance with the Nigerian Constitution and International Labour Organisation .

Title: FirstBank floors Nduka Obaigbena’s GHL at the Court of Appeal
Summary: First Bank of Nigeria Limited (FirstBank) has secured a significant victory at the Court of Appeal, its case against General Hydrocarbons Limited (GHL) The case was filed by their lawyers Babajide Koku SAN and Victor Ogude SAN . FirstBank floors Nduka Obaigbena’s GHL

Title: Natasha issues Clerk four-day ultimatum on reinstatement
Summary: Natasha Akpoti-Uduaghan issues four-day ultimatum on reinstatement . Senator representing Kogi Central Senatorial District has issued a demand for her immediate reinstatement to the Senate .

Title: Obi tackles Tinubu over grid collapses, unkept electricity promises
Summary: Peter Obi berated President Bola Tinubu over power outages in the country due to recurring grid failures . The Labour Party’s (LP) presidential candidate for the 2023 general elections, Peter Obi, has berated the President .

Title: Implementation of 2025 budget  begins in September, says FG
Summary: Implementation of the N54.99 trillion 2025 national budget will begin before the end of September as the 2024 fiscal year winds down . Implementation of 2025 budget begins in September, says the Federal Government .

Title: How self-acclaimed ‘Obi of Lagos’ planned ₦1.5bn scam — Police
Summary: Azubike was arrested alongside three accomplices over an aborted installation ceremony in Amuwo Odofin and unveiling of palace . The self-acclaimed ‘Obi of Lagos’ planned ₦1.5bn scam — Police .

Title: N10bn recovered for aggrieved consumers in 6 months – FCCPC
Summary: Federal Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (FCCPC) said over N10 billion was recovered for aggrieved consumers in Nigeria between March and August 2025 . FCCPC listed banking, Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FCMG), and fintech sectors as leading the top ten sectors from where the commission received the highest number of complaints .

Title: Obi of Lagos: Southern Igbo Ezes, leaders disown Azubike
Summary: Chibuike Azubike recently claimed the title of ‘Obi Ndigbo Lagos’ and announced plans to hold an Ofala festival on September 13 . Igbo traditional rulers and leaders from 12 South-West and South-South states outside Igbo land have disowned him .

Title: ADC Leadship: Battle to remove Mark, Aregbesola continues Monday
Summary: The battle to oust Senator David Mark, Engr. Rauf Aregbesola and other national leaders of the African Democratic Congress, will continue in court on Monday . Despite its recognition by the Independent National Electoral Commission, INEC, the battle to remove Senator Mark continues .

Title: Police arrest mother of newborn dumped in bush in Nasarawa
Summary: Nasarawa State Police Command has arrested a woman alleged to have dumped her newborn baby girl in a bush in Akwanga Local Government Area .

Title: Sani flags off Kaduna road project
Summary: Governor Uba Sani of Kaduna State has inaugurated the reconstruction of the Jaba–Kwoi Road, describing it as a crucial economic artery and a long-overdue intervention for the people of Southern Kaduna . Sani said the project was more than a routine infrastructure undertaking—it was a personal commitment to a region

Title: Edo teenager rejects prostitution after Mali trafficking scam
Summary: Faith Joseph said she was working as a maid in Afuze, Owan East Local Government Area of Edo State, when she was offered a salesgirl job in Lagos State . However, her parents raised an alarm when they discovered that their daughter had been trafficked to Mali . She was eventually rescued and returned to Nigeria with

Title: Police: ‘Obi of Lagos’ admits installation was fraud scheme
Summary: The Lagos State Police Command said the arrested self-acclaimed “Obi of Lagos,” Chibuike Azubike, confessed that the planned installation was a scheme to defraud unsuspecting participants . The command’s Deputy Public Relations Officer, Babaseyi Oluseyi, disclosed this in a statement on

Title: Union membership voluntary, not compulsory – Dangote Refinery
Summary: Dangote Petroleum Refinery said membership of trade unions by its employees remains voluntary and not compulsory . The company stated this in a release on Wednesday while responding to what it described as “distortions of facts” by the Nigeria Union of Petroleum and Natural Gas Workers concerning its trade relations with workers . The refinery stressed that it

Title: No official notice on Nigerians’ deportation to Ghana – FG
Summary: The Federal Government said on Thursday, it had not received any official communication regarding the deportation of Nigerians from the United States to Ghana . This followed reports that Ghana had accepted Nigerians and other West Africans deported from the US under a new arrangement .
